children.content: Normovolemic anemia caused by nutritional deficiency
Pharmacologic therapy (e.g., iron). Avoid transfusion if possible
Evaluate clinical status. Look for signs and symptoms of: Anemia, Fatigue, Lightheadedness, Pallor, Tachycardia, Dyspnea on exertion
RBC transfusion usually needed (higher Hgb may be appropriate in cardiac disease)
Leukoreduction prevents febrile reactions, HLA alloimmunization, CMV transmission
Washing only if history of severe allergic reactions
